title: This Republican SC lawmaker helped block a 'crazily oppressive' abortion bill
description: Senator Sandy Senn believes that legislators cannot tell a woman what is best for her own life.

title: Federal prisons want inmates to pay victims, before making phone calls or buying shoes
description: A proposed Bureau of Prisons rule would put the majority of money sent to an incarcerated person from outside toward restitution or other fines.

title: The wonder of chickens (and their egg song) made me a better person — and parent
description: Our correspondent bought some mail-order chicks. They grew into hens. They changed her life for the better. And then one day ... she heard this wondrous sound.

title: Two doctors struck by tragedy in Sudan: One dead, one fleeing for his life
description: The violence in Sudan has claimed the life of a beloved Sudanese American doctor. One of his colleague's talks about Dr. Sulieman's legacy — and the devastating toll of the fighting in Khartoum.

title: Comic Roy Wood Jr. taps into America's psyche on 'The Daily Show'
description: Wood Jr. will host the White House Correspondents' dinner April 29. In 2018, he explained how the years he spent performing in comedy clubs in the South and Midwest prepared him for The Daily Show.

title: Rep. Jamie Raskin says his cancer is in remission
description: The Maryland Democrat said he'd received a preliminary diagnosis of being in remission after undergoing treatments for lymphoma. "I am overwhelmed with gratitude and love," the lawmaker said.

title: Freight train derails in Wisconsin, plunging 2 containers into the Mississippi River
description: A train carrying lithium-ion batteries, paint and oxygen containers — which can pose a threat to the environment — went off the tracks on Thursday. There's no risk currently, the rail operator says.

title: Hard times are here for news sites and social media. Is this the end of Web 2.0?
description: A steep decline in advertising is forcing an historic shakeup in digital news and social media, and leading some to imagine navigating the internet without the likes of Google or Facebook.

title: A North Carolina court overrules itself in a case tied to a disputed election theory
description: North Carolina's highest court has overruled one of its own rulings, throwing into question if the U.S. Supreme Court will issue a decision on the major elections case known as Moore v. Harper.

title: Strict abortion bans fail in deep-red South Carolina and Nebraska
description: Each law fell a single vote short of passing in their legislatures amid heated debates among Republicans. It's another sign that abortion is becoming a difficult issue for the GOP.

title: The Fed admits some of the blame for Silicon Valley Bank's failure in scathing report
description: The Federal Reserve says its own light-touch approach to bank regulation is partly to blame for the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank last month, and it promised more vigorous oversight in the future.

title: 2 U.S. Army helicopters crash in Alaska, killing 3 soldiers
description: Two U.S. Army Apache helicopters collided and crashed in Alaska while returning from a training flight, killing three soldiers and injuring a fourth. The cause of the crash was under investigation.

title: The U.S.-South Korea Washington Declaration meets with criticism in Seoul
description: An outpouring of criticism has focused on concerns that Seoul gave more than it got, and that the Washington Declaration might even make South Korea's neighborhood a more dangerous place.

title: Brittney Griner says she's 'never going overseas' again after her detention
description: During her first press conference since being detained in Russia, the Phoenix Mercury star told reporters the only thing that'd take her off U.S. soil is an invitation to compete in the Olympics.

title: BBC chair quits over links to loans for Boris Johnson — the man who appointed him
description: A top Conservative Party donor, Richard Sharp was found to have breached rules by failing to disclose a $1 million loan he helped arrange for then-Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

title: After House GOP passes debt ceiling bill, McCarthy gains leverage against Democrats
description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Princeton University political history professor Julian Zelizer about House Speaker Kevin McCarthy's debt ceiling measure. Democrats labeled key provisions "nonstarters."

title: Republicans hope McCarthy's bill gives him leverage in debt ceiling standoff
description: House Republicans narrowly passed a bill linking a debt ceiling raise to spending cuts, which Biden says he would veto. A political historian explains why he may have to make some concessions.

title: Dennis Lehane's 'Small Mercies' is a crime thriller that spotlights rampant racism
description: While set in Boston's Southie in 1974, the story is incredibly timely. It's at once a crime novel, an unflinching look at racism, and a heart-wrenching tale about a mother who has lost everything.

title: Missile and drone strikes across Ukraine claim at least a dozen lives
description: An apartment building in the Ukrainian city of Uman has been hit after a series of airstrikes across the country on Friday. The attack is the deadliest hit on a Ukrainian apartment since January.

title: A magazine touted Michael Schumacher's first interview in years. It was actually AI
description: F1 champion Michael Schumacher hasn't spoken publicly since suffering a near-fatal head injury in 2013. Die Aktuelle fired its editor over the AI-generated piece, and Schumacher's family plans to sue.

title: Fired Tucker Carlson Producer: Misogyny and bullying 'trickles down from the top'
description: A former senior booker for Tucker Carlson Tonight sued Fox News for downplaying her claims of misogyny. That lawsuit names Carlson, among others, as responsible.

title: One way to prevent suicides: limit access to guns
description: Mass shootings and car jackings are terrifying, but suicides actually account for most gun deaths in America. Here's how some people are working to change that.

title: Roy Wood Jr. wants laughs from White House Correspondents' speech — and reparations
description: Daily Show correspondent Roy Wood Jr. is hosting the White House Correspondents' Dinner on Saturday. He spoke with Morning Edition's Leila Fadel about his approach and what he wants to accomplish.

title: Despite mass layoffs, there are still lots of jobs out there. Here's where
description: Mass layoffs have dominated the headlines as huge companies shed hundreds and thousands of workers. But the economy is still adding jobs – 236,000 last month alone.

title: How a gift of kindness from WWII lives on, more than 80 years later
description: Forty years ago, when Brenda Arnold found herself alone in a foreign country, a stranger offered to help. Their own reason for helping traces back to a prisoner of war in WWII.

title: Photographer's decade-long, 600,000-mile journey shows Indigenous life in new book
description: Matika Wilbur was tired of seeing one-dimensional, insipid, degrading depictions of Native Americans in mainstream media and popular culture. So she did something about it.

title: Airbnb let its workers live and work anywhere. Spoiler: they're loving it
description: Airbnb says its Live and Work Anywhere policy is all about winning the global war for talent. A year in, the company and its workers are reaping all sorts of added benefits.

title: Kids under 13 would be barred from social media under bipartisan Senate bill
description: Studies link social media to aspects of America's mental health crisis in adolescents. A handful of bipartisan members of the Senate hope to change that.

title: A bus driver in Michigan fainted at the wheel. Then a 7th-grader took control
description: The driver called the transportation base to tell them she was feeling dizzy and lost consciousness seconds later. Dillon Reeves immediately sprung into action and safely stopped the bus.

title: On James Corden's final show: 'We are all more the same than we are different'
description: Corden told the audience: "There are so many people who are trying to stoke those differences and we have to try as best we can to look for the light, look for the joy. If you do, it's out there."

title: Pranksters posing as Ukraine's president tricked the Fed chair into a phone call
description: The Fed chairperson was tricked into an extended phone call in January with Russian pranksters posing as Ukraine's president, during which the discussion focused on the impact of interest rate hikes.

title: Ed Sheeran sang and played his guitar while on the stand at copyright trial
description: Ed Sheeran was an hour into testimony in Manhattan federal court when his lawyer, Ilene Farkas, pressed him to tell how he came to write "Thinking Out Loud" a decade ago.
